alert.note: Alert for Coos (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 6:59PM EST until December 20 at 3:00AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Portions of Maine, including the following counties, Franklin, Oxford and Somerset and northern New Hampshire, including the following county, Coos. * WHEN...Until 100 AM EST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 659 PM EST, local law enforcement reported heavy rain and snowmelt in the warned area. Flooding is already occurring. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Berlin, Fairfield, Lancaster, Bethlehem, Colebrook, Jackman, Eustis, Rangeley, Skowhegan and Pittsfield.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
